intro: Glossoloma oblongicalyx, commonly known as the broad-lobed hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its large, showy flowers that typically range in color from white to pink. Its leaves are broad and lobed, giving it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along riverbanks.
